fields.description:
You can configure the sender email address for a Jira Cloud project. This will also serve as the reply address for responses to notifications, which can work in conjunction with Creating issues and comments from email.
When you set the sender address for a project, all notifications are sent from this address. Currently, this setting is specific to the project and won't affect the configuration of other projects. We would like to allow outgoing email to be globally set instead of per-project.
fields.summary: Allow outgoing email to be globally set instead of per-project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When pasting URLs into Jira comments in the *new issue view*, sometimes Jira handles specific character sequences as emojis.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Copy a URL that contains a character pattern that represents an emoji
#* Example: https://samplelink.com/this/link/has/:p/emojis
 # Paste this link into a new comment
# Save comment

We have recorded a video of this problem being replicated:  [^emojiURL.mov] 

h3. Expected Results
Link should be rendered as text

h3. Actual Results
Character patterns are handled as Emojis
*  !Screen Shot 2019-09-03 at 3.43.59 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
A possible workaround is to *switch to the old issue view*, edit the comment and update the *Link text*.
*  !Screen Shot 2019-09-03 at 3.36.38 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Emojis should not be rendered in URLs

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When running a search against text fields that contain strings with dash/minus sign "-", you can get some strings which will not be found, where other strings with the same format will be found.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 #  add the string "us-west-2_36500c92-9241-44de-b909-a74c0d8d4cee" to any text field, the description, or a comment.
 # Search for that exact string using the {code:SQL}field ~ "us-west-2_36500c92-9241-44de-b909-a74c0d8d4cee"{code} or {code:SQL} text ~ "us-west-2_36500c92-9241-44de-b909-a74c0d8d4cee"{code} the issue will not be returned.
 # compare this bevaior to the same process but with this string: "us-west-2_d50992f2-d152-43e3-988d-82fbc3ca7341". This string will return the issue when searched for.

h3. Expected Results
 - Either both strings will return their respective issues, or neither string will return their respective issues.

h3. Actual Results

"us-west-2_36500c92-9241-44de-b909-a74c0d8d4cee" returns no results.
"us-west-2_d50992f2-d152-43e3-988d-82fbc3ca7341" returns issues that match.

h3. Notes

substrings of those strings will not match, even when wildcards are used.

h3. Workaround

Use strings with no "-" or "_" to ensure a match, or surround the phrase with quotation marks (e.g. {code}text ~ "\"Test_1234_Test - Time\""{code}), or cite the minus character with double slashes (e.g. {code}text ~ "Test_1234_Test \\- Time"{code}).
fields.summary: JQL search against text fields for phrases with minus "-" character will not return issues that should match

fields.description:
As a user, I'd like to have an option to sync, at the new issue view, the field configuration to the issue layout, respecting the selection and the field visibility.
The new issue view hides important fields and it is a time-consuming task to recreate the screens manually.
fields.summary: Sync the fields from the screen configuration to the issue layout at the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
- In Confluence, it's possible to mention a team as per [this document|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/mentions-724765338.html]. However, this functionality is not available in Jira. 

h3. Suggested Solution
- Provide an ability to mention a team in Jira
fields.summary: Ability to mention a team in Jira

fields.description:
Recently i was looking for sharing a Dashboard with a single or multiple individual users, but would be only able to share with a group or a project. 

Would be a good enhancement to enable sharing both filters and Dashboards with a single or with multiple individual users.
fields.summary: Enable to share Dashboards with a single or multiple individual users

fields.description:
Recently i was looking for sharing a Dashboard with a single or multiple individual users, but would be only able to share with a group or a project. 

Would be a good enhancement to enable sharing both filters and Dashboards with a single or with multiple individual users.

fields.description:
h3. Description
As a user, I'd like to be able to restrict the futureSprint() search to a fixed number instead of returning all the issues from future sprints.

h3. Expected
Be able to restrict the search for the next 5 future sprints or a specific number.

h3. Case
If I have 15 future sprints planned and use the futureSprint() function, it will return the issues for all the 15 future sprints. I'd like to use this function as a macro in confluence to report the next 5 sprints in the roadmap
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to be able to restrict the futureSprint() search to a fixed number

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*

In the Jira Mobile Android application, when viewing an issue, all the fields can be seen populating the screen, whether the field has value or does not have value. 

From a design perspective, user feels it is can be confusing as the experience in the Jira web browser version, the "View" screen does not have these empty fields but when you turn on in the Android application they appear in the "View".  

In cases, such as Jira Service Desk, user has to double check in the web browser to ensure the Service Desk customers are not able to view these fields, just in case. 
h3. Suggested Solution



Give user the ability to hide fields which do not have value, this is because the screen tends to be longer to scroll due to the fields with no value. The user experience is a bit clunky due to this.  

With more fields, you can expect the scroll to be even longer.
fields.summary: Jira Mobile Android - Ability to Hide Empty Fields

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Github recently introduced the draft pull request for their Github Organization accounts. 
- [Introducing draft pull requests \- The GitHub Blog|https://github.blog/2019-02-14-introducing-draft-pull-requests/]

At the moment, there is no way to differentiate between a Draft pull request and a normal pull request in the Workflow trigger which causes a "Pull request created" trigger configured to be executed when a Draft pull request has been created.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a way to differentiate between a draft pull request and a normal pull request in the workflow trigger
fields.summary: Differentiate between a draft pull request and a normal pull request in workflow triggers

fields.description:
*Request*
When looking an 'epic' issue type, I want to be able to drag and drop all the issues within that epic. It should work exactly like https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24547. 

However, this needs to take into account the global rank I have across those issue types (e.g. stories, bugs, tasks) and how it affects my backlog.
fields.summary: Ability to drag and drop issues within an epic on the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* The labels for the GMT offset on timezones are incorrect

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to Jira settings > System > General configuration
 # Click "Edit"
# View timezone options


h3. Expected Results
* GMT offset labels on the timezone settings are correct as per current timezones

h3. Actual Results
* The GMT offsets(GMT+1, GMT+2, GMT+3, etc) do not account for daylight savings time
 !Screenshot 2019-09-03 at 12.04.39.png|thumbnail! 
Screenshot taken 03-Sep-2019.  Cities in the CEST timezone should be GMT+2, not GMT+1

h3. Notes
* The time settings and related functionality is correct.  It's only the GMT offset labels that are incorrect
* Multiple global regions affected

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Default user time zone: GMT offset doesn't account for daylight savings/summer time

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If an attachment upload (e.g. via REST API) does not send a MIME type during its creation, the file will not be displayed in the new issue view afterwards.

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Add an attachment via REST API (using Python);
** E.g.: {code}
r = requests.post(response['self'] + '/attachments', auth=jira_auth,
headers = {'X-Atlassian-Token': 'no-check'}
, files=

{'file': (not_on_tt_trunc[i], open(not_on_tt[i],'rb'))}
)
{code}
* The file may appear in the issue at first, bit they will disappear at an action is taken in the issue.


h3. Expected Results

The file would be still displayed in the issue despite ay actions taken.

h3. Actual Results

The attachment is not displayed in the new issue view.

h3. Notes

The file will work in the old issue view.

h3. Workaround

Make sure a MIME type is added to the file upon the request.

This is an example of how to make it work: {code}r = requests.post(url, auth=jira_auth,
headers = {'X-Atlassian-Token': 'no-check'}, files={'file':(file_name, open(file_name,'rb'), 'application/octet-stream')})
{code}
Special attention to the part *'application/octet-stream'*.
fields.summary: Creating an attachment with no MIME type will prevent the attachment from being displayed in the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At this moment, it is not possible to change the format of the system's "Due date" field to a Date and Time picker.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the format of this field to be changed to a Date and Time picker.

h3. Why this is important
This should improve the user experience by allowing a more granular data to be captured on this field.

h3. Workaround 
A possible workaround would be to create a Date Time Picker custom field (although there would be an administrative overhead to achieve this).
fields.summary: Allow the change of the "Due date" system field to be Date and Time picker

fields.description:
Currently, we can only disable and enable Jira labs for our own profile.
It would be great, the same as disabling for the entire instance as mentioned [here|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-71938] if we could enable and disable the new issue view per project.
fields.summary: Ability to enable/disable new issue view per project

fields.description:
When we search for issues on "Issues and Filters", it returns all users and customers.
It would be good that once we select a specific project on the filter (basic search) it shows only users from that project on reporter/assignee drop down field.
fields.summary: Issues and Filters improvement

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
Batching notifications or Notification Platform (NP) does not work when "Email from" is customised in Jira. This however is not documented in [Jira emails are changing!|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/blog/2019/02/jira-emails-are-changing] page.

h3. Suggested Resolution
Please update the documentation and include clarification about the impact of setting "Email from" for Jira batching notifications.
fields.summary: Update documentation for batching notification (Notification Platform) in Jira

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition

Batching notifications or Notification Platform (NP) in Jira does not support customised "Email from" in *General configuration* page. If "Email from" is not "${fullname} (Jira)" (default setting) batching notifications does not work.
h3. Suggested resolution

Implement the support of customised "Email from" for batching notifications in Jira
h4. Note:

Additionally, the notifications are not batched if users are using "custom from domains" (e.g. they use [jira@mydomain.com|mailto:jira@mydomain.com] instead of the default "@sitename.atlassian.net" under *Project settings > Notifications*) configured on their instance.
fields.summary: Ability to customise "Email from" for batching notifications (Notification Platform)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Issue links in notification sidebar link to old issue view
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Enable the new issue view from the personal settings
* Click on the notification for an issue.
* You will be redirected to the old issue view instead of the new issue view

Recording:

 [^Recording #2.mp4] 
h3. Expected Results

The user will be redirected to the new issue view when clicked on notification as it has been enabled in the site
h3. Actual Results

The user gets redirected to old issue view
fields.summary: Notification sidebar navigates to old issue view instead of new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
h3. Environment
 * Production Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # When you open up an issue (new issue view)
 # Upload multiple images to a comment or description fields.
 # Do not wait for the media picker to finish uploading by quickly clicking the "Insert X files" button on the media picker.
 # Immediately click on the save button on the rich text editor.
 # This does not allow you to save.

h3. Expected Results
 * Allow me to click save after the images have finished uploading

h3. Actual Results
 * Can not click save
 * Please see video attached [^Upload Images fast.mov]

h3. Notes

(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround

Wait for media picker to finish uploading before you click on "Insert X files"
fields.summary: Uploading multiple images on new issue view does not allow saving

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement
The month component does not get properly persisted for date fields when edited in the new issue view. This can also happen when date fields are changed via Jira's issue update REST API or from the roadmap.

This is related to the date format string provided in Jira's date picker format; if the month component is not specified using upper case `M`s, the dates get misinterpreted, see attached video.

h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Go to https://<instance>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/AdvancedApplicationProperties.jspa
 # Enter the *jira.date.picker.java.format* to dd/mm/yyyy (dd/MM/yyyy works fine)
 # Create a new issue and change a date field on the issue in the new issue view (or via REST API, or via roadmap which calls Jira's REST API)

h3. Expected Result
The month correctly gets persisted and does not change on page refresh

h3. Actual Result
Months for the date field do not get persisted properly but revert to "January" after a page refresh

h3. Workaround
 # Go to https://<instance>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/AdvancedApplicationProperties.jspa
 # On "jira.date.picker.java.format", click the *revert* button (or update the month component to be specified using uppercase `M`s)
fields.summary: Date fields do not correctly store the month in Jira

fields.description:
If the create user endpoint {{/rest/api/3/user}} is used with the notification enabled it sends to the customer an email to reset the password, in case the user hasn't set a password yet. However, the link to reset password (https://yourinstance.atlassian.net/secure/ResetPassword.jspa) is leading to the instance instead of lead the customer to reset his password on id.atlassian.com. If the customer tries to reset the password on that link, it gets an error saying "This structure only supports synchronising".

{code}
curl -u EMAIL:APItoken --request POST --url 'https://testinstance.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/user' --header 'Accept: application/json' --header 'Content-Type: application/json'  --data '{
   "name": "Charlie",
   "emailAddress": "charlie@atlassian.com",
   "displayName": "Charlie of Atlassian"
   "notification": "true"
}'
{code}


h3. Summary

Steps to Reproduce

# Use the create user API to sent to a user a notification to reset his password
# This call:
#* {code}
curl -u EMAIL:APItoken --request POST --url 'https://testinstance.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/user' --header 'Accept: application/json' --header 'Content-Type: application/json'  --data '{
   "name": "Charlie",
   "emailAddress": "charlie@atlassian.com",
   "displayName": "Charlie of Atlassian"
   "notification": "true"
}'
{code}


h3. Expected Results

The "set my password" present on the email should lead the user to id.atlassian.com

h3. Actual Results

The link is going to the instance and the user gets an error
*  !error message.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes 

This happens if the user was created but didn't set the password through the invitation email and the endpoint is used to resent the "invitation email".
*  !notification email.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
fields.summary: Using the create user endpoint with notification enabled sends and email with incorrect link

fields.description: If I could right click on a [Jira|https://twitter.com/Jira] story and clone, it would boost velocity by 100%
fields.summary: Option to clone a story using right click option

fields.description:
It would be helpful if on the issue type scheme an effective date range could be configured for issue types such that for projects where that issue type scheme is used, certain issue types can only be selected by users during the configured date interval.

This would have the effect of being able to obsolete an issue type within a project(s) without changing existing tickets.

Use Case: Our company decided to change the way they were handling certain returns issues. The old way was valid but less efficient and caused occasional confusion for the warehouse associates. The new way is more uniform, streamlined, and contains fewer exceptions. Jira tickets for investigation into the cause of each instance are handled very differently and for a while during implementation both processes will exist. The old process will go away after a while so users should no longer be allowed to create those tickets after that point.
fields.summary: Add Effective Date Range to Issue Type in Issue Type Scheme

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Done status tooltip doesn't load on the Chrome browser for the correct description.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open Edit workflow
 # Update the description of the default Done status
 # Publish the workflow
 # Open an issue in Chrome browser, hover the mouse over the Done Status
 # You will see a Tooltip with no description

h3. Expected Results

Tooltip is should load the updated description of *Done* status through the Chrome browser as it is loading in Firefox and Safari.

!image-2019-08-30-20-00-34-022.png|width=263,height=98!
h3. Actual Results

Tooltip is not loading updated description of *Done* status through Chrome browser

!image-2019-08-30-20-01-07-109.png|width=374,height=131!
h3. Workaround

Required, if there is no workaround please state:
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Done status tooltip doesn't load on Chrome for the correct description

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When click in in the *switch to* button (grid button), it will display you options to navigate to other products (Confluence, Jira):
 !Screen Shot 2019-08-30 at 09.10.06.png|thumbnail! 

But currently, it is displaying the option to navigate to a product even if the user has no product access for that one.


h3. Environment

Jira Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Remove a product access from an user;
* Login as that user (or have that user test it), and then click on the switch button.


h3. Expected Results

Only products the user has access to should be displayed.

h3. Actual Results

It displays options to navigate to products the user does not have access to.

See the example:
* The user has no Jira product access:
 !Screen Shot 2019-08-30 at 08.58.08.png|thumbnail! 
* When logging in, it can access Confluence:
 !Screen Shot 2019-08-30 at 08.58.23.png|thumbnail! 
* But, when clicking in the *switch to* button, the options to navigate to Jira are displayed:
 !Screen Shot 2019-08-30 at 08.58.36.png|thumbnail! 
* When accessing it, an error will be displayed:
 !Screen Shot 2019-08-30 at 08.58.46.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

When navigating to Jira without product access, that error message will be displayed in the screen. But it is possible to see a 403 error in the browser console (403 relates to authorization).

If you try to access Confluence without product access, you are prompted to ask for access:
 !Screen Shot 2019-08-30 at 09.07.50.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: "Switch to" button displays option to navigate to products you do not have access to

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a expired Instance
# Go to the *Jira Settings > Apps > Manage apps*
# Try to Install a Paid App

h3. Expected Results
An error should be thrown stating that Installation is not possible because the Instance has expired

h3. Actual Results
The Add-on is unable to install without a clear error. In some case, this long-running task is initiated and due to a Race Condition scenario when installing add-ons.

fields.description:
Your products lack one type of a product - something that would allow us to create software architecture models, like Enterprise Architect:

!https://i.imgur.com/qup3yUj.png!

At the moment we're forced to use detached systems to actually model a solution and track issues.

It would be nice if there would be one centralized system that would allow us to document software, manage requirements and design solutions.

 

Something like Atlassian JIRA + Atlassian Confluence + Enterprise Architect in one package, so we can:
• Document requirements:epics, user stories, generic requirements, something like this:
[https://i.imgur.com/d35vf9N.png]

• Create a model of a solution using UML(not just a bunch of unrelated diagrams)

• Based on a model, create dashboards, sprints, iterations, releases, tasks and other work items issue trackers like Youtrack and JIRA allow us to create depending on what development process we use.

 

It would be nice to have an all-in-one system that can do what Enterprise Architect allows you to do and what JIRA allows us to do with all the benefits: create models specific to iterations. So let's say I create a model for iteration one and start working on a model for iteration 2 based on model from iteration 1 and user stories for iteration2. Then we decide to move a user story from iteration 2 to iteration 1, so I change the model for iteration 1 respectively, and system automatically adds these changes to iteration 2, so I don't have to edit model twice for 2 iterations.
Then we would be able to link model elements(diagrams, UML elements such as components, classes, use cases, etc) and issues. Right now you can only create unrelated diagrams and link them to issues with extensions like SmartDraw:
!https://i.imgur.com/Y9xNuUt.png!


 

But that's far from actual modeling because you can't actually create full models and link work items to components of the solution model.

What do you think about this idea?
fields.summary: all-in-one application lifecycle management system?

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating a child issue inside an Epic, it is not possible to use the Date Picker to fill Due Date field when it is required.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make the Due Date field required and add it to your project screens;
 # Create an Epic;
 # From inside the Epic, try to create a Child Issue using the inline creation;
 # A pop-up will be displayed as the Due Date Field is required;
 # Try to use the calendar icon (date picker) to select a date.

h3. Expected Results

The calendar will open and allow the user to select the desired date.
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens.
h3. Notes

Video reproducing the behavior: [^Screen Recording 2019-08-29 at 04.49 PM.mov]
h3. Workaround

Create the issue with the Due Date field and add it to the Epic later or fill the Epic Link field during the issue creation. Additionally, it is possible to use the Create issue in Epic option available in the board.
fields.summary: When creating a child issue inside an Epic, it is not possible to use the Date Picker to fill Due Date field

fields.description:

fields.description:
This probably needs to be broken into multiple tickets, but it's better told as a single journey of trying to add and delete a gadget.
h3. Experience

After clicking "Add gadget" multiple times and deciding that "Add gadget" was broken, I closed the window to report a bug (couldn't find anywhere in Jira to do that, but that's a different ticket).

When the "Add a gadget" dialog closed, I could see that multiple gadgets had been added.

Not great, but I wanted to move forward.

Clicked "cancel" and nothing happened, again.

Clicking "save" doesn't do anything either.

Had to look in the meatball menu to find a 'delete' option to clear up all the excess gadgets that had been added.

 
h3. Issue summary
 # When you click "Add gadget" there is no indication that a gadget was added.
 # "cancel" and "save" appear to do nothing.
 # "cancel" at this point in the flow would appear to offer the functionality of "delete" in the meatball menu, but does nothing.
 # You can't tell when you've deleted one of multiple gadgets
 ** The gadget placeholder (thing with the "chart title", "chart theme", etc in it) is really tall and there is no delete effect.  This means that if you have added multiple and go to delete one, it appears that the delete didn't work. 
 ** The next one takes it's place with no delay or even a flicker.
 ** There is no visible scrollbar so you can't even tell that there are multiple gadgets.
fields.summary: Creating gadgets needs better UX

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The *Workflow Step Properties* interface only allows you to remove and add properties without the possibility of editing existing properties.

This makes it difficult to manage when having a lot of properties on a *Status*, especially as they are not sorted consistently as mentioned in JRACLOUD-72860.

h3. Proposed solution

Improving the interface as it is for the *Transition Properties* will allow users to better manage the property keys and adjust existing values without being forced to start from scratch.

 !Transition_Properties_-_Start_Progress_-_MPGRY__Project_Management_Workflow_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail! 

{panel:title=Customer feedback}
It is unfortunate that there is currently no workaround for this issue as it becomes very difficult to keep track of all the properties as the list grows large. It would also be nice to have the status properties interface unified with the transition properties interface where you can edit the value without deleting and re-creating the entry
{panel}
fields.summary: Improved interface for Workflow Step Properties

fields.description:

Users without _Browse users & groups_ permission get the error 'Fetch call failed with status code: 403' when added a user in the People section.

The error 'Fetch call failed with status code: 403' is thrown

Workflow status properties are sorted/ordered in an unpredictable fashion that is not consistent.

Default time zone periodically changes to a different time zone.

Jira Cloud

fields.description:

As an agent or Jira user, when filling in fields on a transition screen it would be helpful to see all the issue information. However, because the screen is in a popup that covers the issue view and is in a fixed location, some information may be hidden.

Allow the modal popup to be moved.

fields.description:

It isn't possible to clear a Date Time Picker custom field at the new UI.

 # Create a Date Time Picker custom field 
 # Add the custom field to an issue view screen
 # Add a value
 # Try to remove the value using delete/backspace

h3. Expected Results

When an issue is converted to sub-task, or when a sub-task needs to change its parent's task,  "Select Parent Issue" field will not list down issues as you key in number of text, unless they're in the "History Search".

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Jira is timing out (during transitioning) when an issue having a huge number of History

 # Create an issue with a change log with huge history changes.

h3. Expected Results
 - A full history should be displayed.
 - Able to transition the issues

h3. Actual Results
 - Communication Breakdown appears when going into the History Tab
{code:java}
Communications Breakdown
The Jira server could not be contacted. This may be a temporary glitch or the server may be down.
Close this dialog and press refresh in your browser
{code}

 - The spinning wheel will be displayed for a few minutes when transitioning issues from the and the following error are displayed
{quote}Caught PSQLException for update "public"."changeitem" "CHANGE_ITEM" set "nextchanged" = (select min("SUBSEQUENT_CHANGE_GROUP"."created") from "public"."changegroup" "SUBSEQUENT_CHANGE_GROUP" where "SUBSEQUENT_CHANGE_GROUP"."created" is not null and exists (select 1 from ((select 1 from "public"."changeitem" "SUBSEQUENT_CHANGE_ITEM" where "SUBSEQUENT_CHANGE_ITEM"."oldvalue" is null and "CHANGE_ITEM"."newvalue" is null and "SUBSEQUENT_CHANGE_ITEM"."groupid" = "SUBSEQUENT_CHANGE_GROUP"."id" and "CHANGE_ITEM"."fieldid" = "SUBSEQUENT_CHANGE_ITEM"."fieldid") union all (select 1 from "public"."changeitem" "SUBSEQUENT_CHANGE_ITEM" where "SUBSEQUENT_CHANGE_ITEM"."oldvalue" = "CHANGE_ITEM"."newvalue" and "SUBSEQUENT_CHANGE_ITEM"."groupid" = "SUBSEQUENT_CHANGE_GROUP"."id" and "CHANGE_ITEM"."fieldid" = "SUBSEQUENT_CHANGE_ITEM"."fieldid")) as "subsequent_change_item_conditions" limit ?) and exists (select 1 from "public"."changegroup" "ASSOCIATED_CHANGE_GROUP" where "ASSOCIATED_CHANGE_GROUP"."issueid" = "SUBSEQUENT_CHANGE_GROUP"."issueid" and "SUBSEQUENT_CHANGE_GROUP"."created" > "ASSOCIATED_CHANGE_GROUP"."created" and "ASSOCIATED_CHANGE_GROUP"."id" = "CHANGE_ITEM"."groupid")) where "CHANGE_ITEM"."fieldid" in (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) and "CHANGE_ITEM"."nextchanged" is null and ("CHANGE_ITEM"."fieldid" != ? or "CHANGE_ITEM"."newvalue" is not null) and (select min("SUBSEQUENT_CHANGE_GROUP"."created") from "public"."changegroup" "SUBSEQUENT_CHANGE_GROUP" where "SUBSEQUENT_CHANGE_GROUP"."created" is not null and exists (select 1 from ((select 1 from "public"."changeitem" "SUBSEQUENT_CHANGE_ITEM" where "SUBSEQUENT_CHANGE_ITEM"."oldvalue" is null and "CHANGE_ITEM"."newvalue" is null and "SUBSEQUENT_CHANGE_ITEM"."groupid" = "SUBSEQUENT_CHANGE_GROUP"."id" and "CHANGE_ITEM"."fieldid" = "SUBSEQUENT_CHANGE_ITEM"."fieldid") union all (select 1 from "public"."changeitem" "SUBSEQUENT_CHANGE_ITEM" where "SUBSEQUENT_CHANGE_ITEM"."oldvalue" = "CHANGE_ITEM"."newvalue" and "SUBSEQUENT_CHANGE_ITEM"."groupid" = "SUBSEQUENT_CHANGE_GROUP"."id" and "CHANGE_ITEM"."fieldid" = "SUBSEQUENT_CHANGE_ITEM"."fieldid")) as "subsequent_change_item_conditions" limit ?) and exists (select 1 from "public"."changegroup" "ASSOCIATED_CHANGE_GROUP" where "ASSOCIATED_CHANGE_GROUP"."issueid" = "SUBSEQUENT_CHANGE_GROUP"."issueid" and "SUBSEQUENT_CHANGE_GROUP"."created" > "ASSOCIATED_CHANGE_GROUP"."created" and "ASSOCIATED_CHANGE_GROUP"."id" = "CHANGE_ITEM"."groupid")) is not null and "CHANGE_ITEM"."groupid" in (select "CHANGE_GROUP"."id" from "public"."changegroup" "CHANGE_GROUP" where "CHANGE_GROUP"."issueid" = ?)

It seems that you have tried to perform an illegal workflow operation.

If you think this message is wrong, please contact your [Jira administrators|https://iscapejira.atlassian.net/secure/ContactAdministrators!default.jspa].
{quote}

h3. Workaround
 * Clone the issue, link it with the original issue and use the cloned issue. Or
 * Use CSV import with just 3 required columns and map it accordingly. - [https://URL.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ExternalImport1.jspa]
{noformat}
Issue key, status, summary
ABC-1 In Progress, Test ticket
{noformat}

fields.description:
h4. Summary
When running JQL *ORDER BY Desc*, JIRA places the issue with null value for that field at the highest order, instead of at the lower order. According to the documentation from [PostgreSQL 8.3.23|https://www.postgresql.org/docs/8.3/queries-order.html] the {{NULLS FIRST}} is the default for {{DESC order}}, but is configurable. 

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Having 3 issues with value for a custom field as 1, 2, and _null_
# Run JQL query: {{ORDER BY <cusom_field> Desc}}

h4. Actual Result
JIRA places the _null_ value at the highest rank
_null_
2
1
!jql.png|thumbnail!

h4. Suggestion
JIRA could order the issues as follows:
2
1
_null_
fields.summary: JQL "ORDER BY Desc" place null at the highest order

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When viewing an issue's *History Tab* in the new issue view, number custom fields will not display the correct value if a value higher than 99 is set.

h3. Environment
New issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Update an issue's *number custom field*
 # Switch to the History Tab to view issue's historical changes
 # Scroll until the change made in *step 1* is displayed

h3. Expected Results
Just as in the old issue view, the exact number was expected to be displayed:
*  !Screen Shot 2019-08-27 at 5.26.35 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The actual value is truncated to "99+"
*  !Screen Shot 2019-08-27 at 5.26.18 PM.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround
This behavior can only be observed when using Jira's *New issue view*. Switching back to the old view allows users to view the exact number that was set at a given time. 
* To turn the new issue view off in Jira Software and Jira Core for now, click your avatar picture and navigate to *Personal settings*. There, toggle the switch for the New Jira issue view.
fields.summary: History Tab on New Issue View Truncates Number Fields to 99

fields.description:
*Problem definition:*
When searching for a project within another project, the autocomplete list blocks the view to select one project:

!image1.png|thumbnail!

We can verify that this happens because of the attribute autocomplete that is turned on:

!image2.png|thumbnail!

*Suggested Solution:*
Turn off the autocomplete attribute for this search field:

autocomplete="off"

*Workaround:*
We have two different workarounds:
h5. Option 1
The first one is to access directly the attribute and turn it off:
# Access the search field to type the name of the project that would like to search
# Before typing the name of the project click with the right button and select Inspect
!image3.png|thumbnail!
# Select the autocomplete attribute
# Put 'off' instead of 'on'
Video:
[^video1.mp4]

h5. Option 2
The second option is to just run a script that would turn off the autocomplete attribute:
# Access the search field to type the name of the project that would like to search
# Before typing the name of the project click with the right button and select Inspect
# Select the 'Console' tab
# Paste and run the following script:
{code}
var elements = document.querySelectorAll('.SingleLineTextInput__EditView-sc-4hfvq0-1');
    for(let i = 0; i < elements.length; i++) {
        console.log(elements[i])
        elements[i].setAttribute('autocomplete', 'off');
    }
{code}
Video:
[^video2.mp4]
fields.summary: Autocomplete list to search for projects blocks the view to select a project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Setting the *skipRemoteOnlyCondition* for the endpoint *Get transitions* - {code}GET "/rest/api/3/issue/{issueIdOrKey}/transitions"{code} - to *true* or *false* returns the same results.

h3. Environment
Jira REST API.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a classic project;
 # In the workflow, select a transition and add the condition *Hide From User Condition*;
 # Publish the workflow;
 # Choose one issue to get the issue key;
 # On the browser, for example, run the following request:
{code}https://<Instance>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/issue/<Issue key>/transitions?skipRemoteOnlyCondition=false{code}
# And then
{code}https://<Instance>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/issue/<Issue key>/transitions?skipRemoteOnlyCondition=true{code}

Watch [this video|https://cl.ly/50a6547a5f00] for reference.

h3. Expected Results
||skipRemoteOnlyCondition||Response||
|true|Hide From User Condition is *not included* in the response|
|false|Hide From User Condition is *included* in the response|

h3. Actual Results
The *false* option doesn't return the transitions that have the *Hide From User Condition*

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: The query parameter "skipRemoteOnlyCondition" for the endpoint "Get transitions" in the REST API doesn't return correct information

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating a new field during a CSV import, it is possible to select a field type called *Bug import iD*.

But, if you do so, the created field cannot be searched, neither in basic search nor in advanced search.

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Perform a CSV import;
* During the field mapping, create a new field:
 !Screen Shot 2019-08-27 at 10.28.48.png|thumbnail! 
* Select the *Bug Import ID* field type:
 !Screen Shot 2019-08-27 at 10.26.22.png|thumbnail! 
* Finish the import;
* Try to search for that field.

h3. Expected Results

The field should be returned in the search.

h3. Actual Results

No options are displayed towards that field.

h3. Notes

It seems that the *Bug import ID* field type is not even supported anymore. If that's the case, and give the fact that it causes a problem, the option of using it during field creation should be removed.

h3. Workaround
Gather the issues that were imported with that field value, getting their *keys*.

Build a CSV (or edit the one that was imported during the process where you've created the field) that will contain the following columns :
* *Field that will replace the affected one*: this column will contain the values you wanted to use in that field. During the import, create a new custom field, but use a valid type.
* *Summary*: this column should be left empty (only the header will be kept). This will be matched agains the issue summary during the import;
* *Issue key*: this column will contain the keys of the issues you want to update.

Here's an example:  [^workaround.csv] 

When importing that file, it should only update the affected issues, creating a new field that will replace the one affected by that problem.
fields.summary: Cannot perform searches towards fields created as Bug Import ID type during CSV import

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When creating an Epic through the *Create Epic* button of the *Backlog* page, custom fields are not displayed by default.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 
It provides us with the option to show the field by ticking it from a list of field options:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

However, there's no option to show the field as a default for the screen. Thus, every time an epic needs to be created, the user needs to tick the field to show up on the create screen.

This is only applied for this screen, whereas for the other create screens, it works as expected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field 
 # Associate it with the respective screens
 # Click on *Create epic* button of the *Backlog* page

h3. Expected Results
Once the custom field is ticked to appear, it's expected to be shown as default for the next issues creation.

h3. Actual Results
Custom fields disappear from the screen and the user needs to tick them again.

h3. Workaround
Epic needs to be created by the + button on the left side to have the fields shown as it should.
fields.summary: Custom fields are not displayed by default in Create Epic screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Jira Cloud, when you paste a Github link (i.e. Pull request link) into Jira Cloud (New Editor), the link is converted to the automatic preview. In order to view details of the link (i.e. Pull Request's status), it is required to connect an account to the and then you get the following error:
 !Screen Shot 2019-08-26 at 11.20.20 AM.png|thumbnail! 

Connect your account to preview links

If you click to connect, you are taken to a page in Github to authorize Jira's access.

 !Screen Shot 2019-08-26 at 11.20.33 AM.png|thumbnail! 

Once you connect, you return back to the page in Jira, but the message is still displayed.

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue in Jira.
# In the new issue view, paste a link to a Github object (i.e. Pull request) to a comment. Save the comment.
# On the page, click the warning to connect your account. Connect your account.

h3. Expected Results
You should now have connected Github to your account and no longer receive the warning.

h3. Actual Results
The warning hasn't changed.

h3. Notes
This also affects links to other applications such as *Google Drive*.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available. 

(i) Although this is *not a workaround* for the problem, users who are concerned with the fact that the *Connect your account* button is being displayed can manually remove this by going through the following steps:
# Switch to the *old issue view*
# *Edit* the comment that is being rendered incorrectly as a smart link
# Remove the *|smart-link* reference at the end of the link
# Save the comment

This will cause the link to be rendered as a regular text link, therefore removing the *Connect your account* button. When this problem is resolved, however, the only way of getting the smart links back is by manually inserting *|smart-link* reference once again.
fields.summary: Connect your account to preview links error on External links

fields.description:
h2. The problem: WYSIWYG causes more scrolling on long tickets

We prefer writing in plain markdown so we don't have to scroll to the top each time we want to format something, for example, making a header. Especially when writing a long ticket, we end up scrolling up and down a lot.

It is also inconsistent when we see editing by WYSIWYG or markdown, for example the add issue modal is markdown, but editing the same ticket's description on the view issue screen is WYSIGWY. This means we have to shift our text formatting mindset while working on tickets.
h2. Solution idea: Toggle between markdown and WYSIWYG

We could toggle between WYSIWYG and markdown editing modes on description and paragraph fields when creating and editing issues. This setting could be remembered for each user across all projects and issues.

This would be great as part of Next Gen projects.
fields.summary: Next Gen: Toggle between markdown and WYSIWYG

fields.description:
h2. Classic projects: Could put formatted content in block quote

With Classic project issues, you could put content on a block quote, which we often used if directly quoting client feedback.
h2. Next Gen: Can't do this

On the Next Gen boards, there is a quote feature in the WYSIWYG editor.

But if you try to make a quote out of something with any additional formatting, like bullet points or inline images, you can’t place that formatted text in the quote.

You can could with the old method.
fields.summary: Next Gen: Formatted block quotes

fields.description:
h2. The problem: Board rules can not be set based on custom fields

I was excited to see board rules, but then realized they lacked some flexibility, like creating them based off of custom fields.
h2. Solution idea: Allow creating rules based on certain types of custom fields, like "People" fields

If we could create rules based off of custom fields, we could do scenarios like this:

_Rule: Assign an issue to someone based off of a custom field_

If we had a custom field for "QA Assignee", whenever the issue got updated with the custom status "QA", assign whoever is inside the "QA Assignee" field.
fields.summary: Next Gen Board "Rules": Create rule based on custom field

fields.description:
h2. The problem: Manually set up each new Next Gen project from scratch

Currently, we have to manually set up each new Next Gen project's board columns, issue types, and fields. This takes time to start from scratch each time, and it's easy to forget to customize something.
h2. Solution idea: Share project settings across projects or duplicate projects

Share Next Gen project settings across projects - or duplicate a project to keep its settings.

Maybe share custom issue types and statuses across projects for better reporting across projects, as well. For example, a custom issue type called "Design" could be re-used across multiple projects, rather than creating duplicate "Design" issue types for each.
fields.summary: Next Gen: Share settings across projects or duplicate projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Selecting a date from 2030 and the following years converts the date to 19xx

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud / Old view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On a date field (using the new or old view) like Due Date or Date/Time, select the date 01/01/2035.
 # Click out of the field.

h3. Expected Results

It will show correctly the year 2035.

h3. Actual Results

On the new view, it shows correctly, but if we open the ticket using the old view or exporting the issue, it will show 1935.

h3. Workaround

Use only the new issue view and when export the CSV, it will be necessary to manually adjust the date.

 !Screenshot 2019-08-23_15-26-50-579.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screenshot 2019-08-23_15-35-24-465.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screenshot 2019-08-23_15-35-49-257.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Selecting a date from 2030 and the following years converts the year to 19xx

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using the new issue view, the *Save* button becomes unresponsive when uploading a file if you hit *Insert a file* before the upload has finished.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# use the new issue view
# click on the insert a file or image button
# add an attachment of a few Mb and hit *Insert a file* before the upload finishes
# try saving the comment

This problem can be replicated consistently in different browsers.

h3. Expected Results

The upload finishes and the comment is added

h3. Actual Results
 
The upload finishes but the *Save* button doesn't work. You can try to re-upload the file multiple times but still doesn't work. You need to *cancel* that existing comment, then open the comment box again to start the process again.

So effectively you break the comment box when doing this until you reopen it.

h3. Workaround

Wait for the file to finish the upload before hitting the *Insert file*
fields.summary: Save button becomes unresponsive if you try to add attachment before the upload finishes

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

When starring an unsaved filter from *My Open Issue*, the starred filter gadget gave a very generic error.

When savin
h3. *Steps to Reproduce*

 # Add a Starred filter gadget on the System Dashboard

# The gadget return *Looks like something went wrong retrieving your filters :(. Please try reloading this dashboard.*

h3. *Expected Results*

The gadget should warn the user that they are trying to star an unsaved filter.

h3. *Actual Results*

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
CSV import (through issue navigator) fails to create issue when *Reporter*, *Assignee* or *User Picker* fields are set. Following error appears for validation:
 !Screenshot 2019-08-23 at 5.16.40 PM.png|thumbnail! 

Issue is not created and same error appears if CSV import is performed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set a user picker filed/column in CSV file. For example
{noformat}
summary, reporter, assignee, developer (custom field)
Test issue, testuser, testuser, testuser
{noformat}
#* *testuser* is username of an existing user, issue persist if email address or accountId is being used instead
# Perform CSV import through *Issue navigator* (search issue page) > *Import issues from CSV*

h3. Expected Results
Issue is created

h3. Actual Results
* Following error appears for validation:
 !Screenshot 2019-08-23 at 5.16.40 PM.png|thumbnail! 
* Following error appears if *Reporter* field is set:
{noformat}
Issue can't be created due to the error/s [ The reporter specified is not a user.]
{noformat}
* Following error appears for User Picker field (customer field):
{noformat}
Issue can't be created due to the error/s [ User '<accountId>' does not exist. ]
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Import through *Jira settings* > *System* > *External System Import* > *CSV Import*
fields.summary: CSV import fails to set user picker fields (e.g assignee, reporter, custom field)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When we try to add more than 1 user to a project at a time and one user already exists it gives an error message saying one user already exists in the project and then all the other users have to be added again.
h3. Environment
Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to project settings 
 # People
 # Try to add multiple users with any role but include a user with is already a member

h3. Expected Results
The user that is already a member will be ignored but other users will be added properly.
h3. Actual Results
gives an error message saying one user already exists in the project and then all the other users have to be added again.
 !Screen Shot 2019-08-22 at 09.43.42.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Error if try to add multiple users with a project role but the user already a member

fields.description:
{panel:title=(i) Bug Fix Policy| borderStyle=| borderColor=| titleBGColor=#e0efff| bgColor=}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for the fix to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes bugfixes.
You can learn more by reading [Atlassian Cloud Bug Fixing Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-cloud-bug-fixing-policy-206865884.html].
{panel}

h3. Issue Summary

Several users can't login to Jira Cloud via iOS app.
This started occuring along with [username sunsetting|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2018/06/say-goodbye-to-usernames-in-atlassian-cloud] in Atlassian Cloud.

h3. Environment

* Jira Cloud on iOS app

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Enable G Suite integration on the site
# Login to Jira Cloud via iOS app


h3. Expected Results

Every user can login to Jira Cloud via iOS app

h3. Actual Results

Some users cannot login to Jira Cloud via iOS app, seeing:

 !IMG_0735.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Use the mobile web instead. 
Also consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of the bug moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Several users can't access Jira Cloud via iOS app

h3. Issue Summary

If user's full name contains a reserved characters such as {{[]}}, mentions function doesn't work properly.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Change your full name to "[A] Charlie Atlassian"
**  !jac1-full-name.png|thumbnail!  
# Go to the personal setting page and make sure to turn off *New Jira issue view*
**  !jac2-new-jira-issue-view.png|thumbnail! 
# Go to an arbitorary issue and mention to yourself in the comment section
** !jac3-autocompletion.png|thumbnail! 
# Verify the mention doesn't work
** !jac4-comment.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected Results

You can mention to any users.

h3. Actual Results

You cannot mention to users whose full name contains reserved characters.

h3. Workaround

Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of the bug moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.

Until then, manually escape the reserved characters like:

{code:none}
[\[A\] Charlie Yamamoto|~accountid:557058:6b604473-3fb5-4e93-9128-e77506dec8c9]
{code}
fields.summary: Comment mentions don't escape reserved characters in the old Jira issue view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, issue collector error messages are vague and don't explain what exactly is happening, for example:

{{Required fields not present or fields too long in collector...}}

Although it explains the problem is related to required fields, it doesn't describe which field is causing the problem.

h3. Suggested Solution

Issue collector messages should provide more details about the cause of the problem, like the name of the filter causing the problem, etc.
fields.summary: As a Jira user, I want to have clearer error messages in the issue collector feature

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Inside the project release page, clicking to view in issue navigator causes the search unable to be switched to basic mode.
It displays the project ID and the release ID instead of the Project Name and the Release name/version.
Due to that, for non-tech users, it is not possible to switch from the advanced mode to the basic search mode.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access a project
# Click on releases
# Select a Fix Version
# Click to view in the issue navigator

h3. Expected Results
The issue navigator should load using the project name and the fix version title instead of the ID and should be able to switch over to the basic search

h3. Actual Results
The issue navigator loads using the project ID and release ID causing the option to switch to the basic search be unavailable.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Inside the project release page, clicking to view in issue navigator causes the search unable to be switched to basic mode.

fields.description:
Currently, it's not possible to order the list of watchers, so it's complicated to find names within the list when it has a lot of watchers.
It would be great if we had the option to sort the watchers list alphabetically.
fields.summary: Sort the Watchers List Alphabetically

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the new issue view, if you have a priority with space after the priority name, lower issue priorities are not displayed in the "Priority" field in the issue view

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# As an administrator, click *Jira settings > Issues > Priorities*
# Next to *High*, click *Edit*
# In the *Name* filed, add a space after *High* or copy the following text and paste in the field (without quotations): "High "
# Click *Update*
# Access a Jira issue and change its priority to *High*, then try to change the priority again

h3. Expected Results

All priorities are displayed

h3. Actual Results

The lower priorities are not displayed

 !Screen Shot 2019-08-22 at 2.58.57 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2019-08-22 at 2.59.16 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes


h3. Workaround

Remove the white space from the priority name. To do it, please follow the steps described below:

# As an administrator, click *Jira settings > Issues > Priorities*
# Next to *High*, click *Edit*
# In the *Name* filed, remove the space after *High *
# Click *Update*
fields.summary: Issues' priorities with space after the name cause problems in the new issue view

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 14 October 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone, thank you for your interest surrounding this ticket. Before we begin [transitioning all users to the new issue view|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/Transitioning-all-Jira-Cloud-users-to-the-new-issue-view/ba-p/1494104] on 31 March, 2021, we’ll be solving this problem. Watch this ticket for updates as we progress and please add a comment for any questions you may have.
{panel}

h3. Problem

The created/updated fields are stored in the very bottom of the page when viewing a ticket in the new issue view. Sometimes it is hard to find these fields, depending on how many fields you have.

h3. Suggested resolution

Have the ability to change the created/updated fields location in the issue view.
fields.summary: Ability to change created/updated fields location

- {{project = TEST AND status in (Open, Testing) AND filter != 48753}}

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The documentation [Advanced searching - fields reference|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/advanced-searching-fields-reference-764478339.html#Advancedsearching-fieldsreference-DescriptionDescription] says that to return issues where the description contains the exact phrase, users should use quotation marks, but when a user searches using quotation marks, for example, {{text ~ "\"Number of tests \""}}, other issues which contains some expressions are returned also
h3. Environment

Jira cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Jira project and add issues to it
 # Add the following text to the description of different issues (use each sentence to each issue)
 ** Number of tests made on this ticket
 ** Number made tests
 ** Number
 ** tests
 # Perform a search in Jira using the following JQL query

{code:java}
text ~ "\"Number of tests \""{code}
h3. Expected Results

Only the issue containing the text "{{Number of tests made on this ticket}}" is returned

!Screen Shot 2019-08-21 at 7.59.36 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

The issues containing the text below are returned:
 * Number of tests made on this ticket
 * Number made tests

h3. Notes
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 21st Jan 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
After some analysis we've found that this issue has been duplicated by the issue at JRACLOUD-69263: JQL Contains "Exact Phrase" does not return the result as expected. This is a current and verified bug in Jira, please watch that issue for further updates and more detailed workarounds.
{panel}
fields.summary: Searching for text using quotation marks doesn't return the exact phrase

fields.description:

As an Admin, I would like to be able to choose which project roles will be displayed in each project type. This feature is especially necessary when separating Jira Service Desk project roles from other project types.
fields.summary: Allow the ability to choose which project roles will be displayed in each Project Type

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Currently, it is not possible to set the profile's timezone to any Indiana times. Although it is possible to set them through the site's *General Settings* page, it's not possible to use those timezones in the user profile. The affected options are:
* !Screen Shot 2019-08-21 at 5.34.12 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click your avatar picture at the bottom left corner of your screen and open *Personal Settings*
 # Under "Your Timezone", select any of the options highlighted in the image below
 # Click *Save Changes*

h3. Expected Results
Profile settings are updated

h3. Actual Results
Error saying *Couldn't save your preferences* is returned
*   !Screen Shot 2019-08-21 at 5.30.26 PM.png|thumbnail!

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available. Still, it is possible to choose other *GMT-05:00* options that are not listed above.

 !Screen Shot 2019-08-21 at 14.35.51.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
When using issue types in the same workflow in company-managed projects, it is possible to change the Issue type of a specific issue by simply clicking on the issue type Icon in the left side of the issue key and selecting the new issue type.

In team-managed, you get redirected to the Move operation, and then you need to select the new issue type again and click three more times to get the issues moved to the new issue type.

It would be great if that simpler option could be implemented in team-managed.
fields.summary: Changing issue type in team-managed projects redirect you to the Move operation

fields.description:

When removing a user, the Jira issues which the user is assignee or reporter are changed to Inactive or Former user.

It would be nice if when removing a user it was possible to bulk move the issues where the user is reporter or assignee to another user.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The attachment selection pop-up does not resize itself based on the resolution of the screen when on issue create screen. Due to this, the upload button gets hidden.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Start with create issue
 # Click on browse to add an attachment
 # Increase the zoom of the browser (replicate high resolution) on attachment selection pop-up.

h3. Expected Results

The pop-up box resizes itself based on the resolution as it gets done when viewing the pop-up from an already created issue.
h3. Actual Results

The pop-up box does not resize itself.
h3. Workaround

Zoom out in the browser to view the upload button.
fields.summary: Attachment select pop-up does not resize according to screen resolution on the issue create screen

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When adding a _ Field Required_ *Validator* for the *Attachment* field in the _Create issue_ transition of your Workflow, your CSV import will fail, despite including attachment values in your file.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the _Create issue_ transition in your Workflow and add a _Field Required_ *Validator* for the *Attachment* field
# In your CSV file, include attachments

 !_JST-500442__Getting_error_for_CSV_import_-_Atlassian_Support_System.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The CSV file is expected to be successfully imported as attachments are defined for every Issue as required by the Workflow.

h3. Actual Results

The import fails with a very generic "Error importing issue" message. (see JRACLOUD-67325 for improvements on these generic errors)

 !External_System_Import_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Workaround

No workaround, remove the *Validator*.
fields.summary: Adding a Workflow Validator for attachments breaks CSV imports

fields.description:
h3. Issue Statement
Webhook response doesnot capture Email address anymore.
After the recent Changes to set the privacy settings on the Email address on the User Account, the webhook no longer send Email address as part of the data.

This not only affects the Atlassian accounts but also affects the Email address of the Service desk Customers. 

h3. Steps to replicate
* Trigger a Webhook from Jira
* Read the JSON response captured.
* We observe that Email address is missing.
fields.summary: Webhook response doesnot capture Email address anymore.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When moving a child issue that is added to an Epic in a classic project to a Next-Gen, the issue keeps linked to the Epic, however, the child issues are not displayed in the New Issue View.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Epic in a Classic project;
# Link 2~3 issues from the Classic project in the created Epic;
# Move 1 issue to a Next-Gen project.

h3. Expected Results

Display all the child issues in both new and old issue view.

h3. Actual Results

Child issues are only displayed in old issue view
 !Image 2019-08-16 at 11.14.11 AM.png|thumbnail!  !Image 2019-08-16 at 11.11.24 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Use the old issue view if you need to move issues linked to an Epic from a Classic to a Next-Gen project.
fields.summary: Moving child issues from Epics to a Next-Gen project, do not display the child in the New Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While on an issue view page if you search any issue by pasting the issue key from an Excel file, it creates an attachment in that issue.

h3. Environment

Jira cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create an Excel file with some issue keys on it
# Open an issue in view mode using the Jira new issue view
# Click on JIRA search button (magnifier icon) in the left menu, 
# Copy the issue key from Excel file and paste it in the search field

h3. Expected Results

The issue search show the issue if it exists or says that the issue doesn't exist

h3. Actual Results

It creates the attachment with search issue key

 !Screen Shot 2019-08-20 at 8.24.26 PM.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2019-08-20 at 8.24.58 PM.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2019-08-20 at 8.25.05 PM.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Notes

If affects only the new issue view

h3. Workaround

Disable the new issue view. To do it, please follow the steps described below:

# Go to Jira home page and click on the avatar at the bottom-left of the screen and then click on *Personal settings*
# Under *Jira labs*, next to *New Jira issue view for software projects*, disable this feature by clicking on the green button (it will become gray and a feedback pop-up will appear)
fields.summary: Searching any issue by pasting the issue key from an Excel file, it creates an attachment in that story

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using having the user preference for *Email notifications format* set to *Text* the email notifications from JIRA will contain the user's Account ID instead of their full name.
https://atl-vertigo-kasper.atlassian.net/secure/ViewPersonalSettings.jspa
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set your notifications format to Text at:
{noformat:none|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3|bgColor=#F8F8F8}
https://{instance}.atlassian.net/secure/ViewPersonalSettings.jspa
{noformat}
# Have another user mentioning you on a ticket or comment.

h3. Expected Results

The notification sent to your email should contain the user's full name.

h3. Actual Results

The notification received only have the user Account ID:
 !Screen_Shot_2019-08-20_at_18_31_37.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Set your *Email notifications format* set to *HTML*.
You can also change the default user preferences to HTML at:
{noformat:none|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3|bgColor=#F8F8F8}
https://{instance}.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewUserDefaultSettings.jspa
{noformat}

This will apply the change to all users to from your instance.
fields.summary: Notifications sending user Account ID instead of full name

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Clearing the default Resolution value returns an error referencing a missing "XSRF Security Token". Because of this, it is not possible to clear the default Resolution value, only to choose a new one.  

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On a cloud site, go to *Jira Settings > Issues > Resolutions*
 # Click *Clear defaults*

h3. Expected Results
Default value is cleared

h3. Actual Results
Error is returned.
*  !Screen Shot 2019-08-20 at 2.54.44 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: "Clear defaults" Button to Clear Default Resolution Returns "XSRF Security Token Missing"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Cut/Copy an image, then, pasting it in the same issue description will cause an error and the new edit can't be saved.

Drag and drop an image, however, will result in a blank image.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue with inline images in its description e.g.:
 !description.png|thumbnail! 
 # Perform an inline edit for the description and click on the image. Cut or copy it.
 # Paste it again and try to save.

# During the inline edit, drag and drop the image to another line.
# Save the description.
# Image appears as blank.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Saving the edit successfully.

h3. Actual Results
Hit into an error and new edit can't be saved.
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

In browser's developer tools:
{noformat}
{"errorMessages":["Exception occurred: {\"failure\":{\"failure\":\"[30001]: MALFORMED_JSON\",\"reasons\":[]}}"],"errors":{}}
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Edit in old issue view. 
e.g https://instancename.atlassian.net/browse/issue-key?oldIssueView=true
fields.summary: Cut/Copy and paste an image caused an error in new issue view

fields.description:
Currently, if you copied a color text from Confluence legacy editor or Jira old issue view description and paste it on the new issue view editor, The color text would not preserve since both editors rendered RGB color differently. 

 

It would be a "Good to have" feature to have this implement in the new issue view. Also, the color text from Fabric editor is kinda limited, by increasing the RGB colors renders from the editor will definitely help in day to day operation for our customer.
fields.summary: Preserve color text copied from Jira/Confluence and increase the RGB color render from new issue view.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Log Time in Jira issue (with Tempo) pressing 'w' shortcut or via the panel(three dots), the issue field does not auto-populate the issue key

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open an issue in New Jira view
 # Press ‘w’ from keyboard to open Log Time, or click three dots on the right will expand the panel and select Log Time
# Log Time window opens with No pre-populated issue-key

h3. Expected Results
The issue key should auto-populates while logging work

h3. Actual Results
The issue-key doesn’t auto-populate, but it has to be manually selected.

h3. Workaround

Please switch to Old view either from the top navigation link appearing on each Jira issue page. Or by going to:
 1. Personal account settings 
2. Jira Labs 
3. New Jira issue view 
4. Disable the feature
fields.summary: Log Time in Jira issue (with Tempo) pressing 'w' shortcut or via the panel(three dots), the issue field does not auto-populate the issue key

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

 # Sample query:
{noformat}
(issue.property[EA-schedules].tags is not empty OR duedate is not empty OR cf[16250] is not empty) AND issuetype NOT IN subtaskIssueTypes() ORDER BY cf[11770]
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results

JQL search returns result.
h3. Actual Results

It is timing out (no result returned)
h3. Notes

Stack trace:
{noformat}

	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.receiveErrorResponse(QueryExecutorImpl.java:2477)

	at org.postgresql.jdbc.PgPreparedStatement.executeQuery(PgPreparedStatement.java:117)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor296.invoke(Unknown Source)

	at org.vibur.dbcp.proxy.StatementInvocationHandler.on(StatementInvocationHandler.java:214)
	at com.atlassian.jira.connpool.JiraViburConnectionPoolProvider.lambda$null$14(JiraViburConnectionPoolProvider.java:210)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Adding an attachment to a Jira comment in the new issue view.

h3. Environment
Jira cloud new issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Jira issue while in the new issue view
# Click the comment box
# From the editor menu select "Files & image"
# Upload a video file and click insert
# Now click save 

h3. Expected Results
The comment is saved with the attached video

h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:

Refresh the page and try again.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Saving issue type changes for "Incident" in a next-gen project that was a JiraOps project formerly, causes following error to appear: 
{panel}
h4. (!) Could not save your changes
Sorry, something went wrong and we couldn’t update your “Incident” issue type.
{panel}

h3. Notes
Jira Ops projects have been converted to Next-gen projects, for more information please see: [Concluding the Jira Ops early access program|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Ops-discussions/Concluding-the-Jira-Ops-early-access-program/td-p/1048857]

This has also brought following template into *Description* field in "Incident" issue type:
{panel}
*Customer impact*

Not yet known.


*Mitigation plan*

To be decided.


*Suspected causes*

Not yet known.
{panel}


h3. Steps to Reproduce
* To replicate this issue you should have a next-gen project that was a JiraOps project formerly and auto-converted to a next-gen project
# Go to the next-gen project > *Project settings* > *Issue types* > *Incident*
# Make a change, e.g add a field
# Click on *Save changes*

h3. Expected Results
Changes are saved and following message appears:
{panel}
h4. Success
"Incident" updated.
{panel}

h3. Actual Results
Changes are not saved and following error appears:
 !Screenshot 2019-08-13 at 5.06.57 PM.png|thumbnail! 
A 400 error appears in browser DevTools:
{code}
{"errorMessages":["Failed to update issue type: defaultValue should be Map"],"errors":{}}
{code}

h3. Workaround
If you want to keep the template in *Description* field, copy the template and save the changes, then re-add the template and save the changes again. Or remove the template if you don't wish to keep the template in *Description* field.
fields.summary: Description template in next-gen project prevents saving changes in "Incident" issue type

fields.description:
{panel:title=(i) Implementation of New Features Policy| borderStyle=| borderColor=| titleBGColor=#e0efff| bgColor=}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for this feature to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes new features.
You can learn more by reading [Implementation of New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].
{panel}

h3. Problem Definition

With the recent GDPR changes to allow restrictions for profile information:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/update-your-profile-and-visibility-settings-976161175.html

When trying to mention user at comment field, the email is written as "undefined" and there's no information what "undefined" stands for.
Because of it, users cannot understand what's the required action to browse it where needed.


h3. Suggested Solution

Clarify:

* it's the email field, and
* why it's concealed, and
* what's the action to browse it

h3. Workaround

The mentioned user should set the corresponding field's visibility to "anyone" or "the name of your organization" (your organization admin should subscribe and setup [Atlassian Access|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/apply-atlassian-access-policies-and-features-938859736.html]).

Also consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Show the user-friendly message when user list displays "undefined" beside the name when trying to mention user at comment field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In project *Backlog*, hover of *Share* button in issue preview is broken. 
 
h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a scrum project, navigate to *Backlog*
# Create an epic and add a task in the epic.
# In the backlog view, previs the task created and the hover of *Share* button in the issue view is broken.

h3. Expected Results
Hover of Share button should be shown complete

h3. Actual Results
Hover of the share button seems broken

h3. Notes
Share button functionality works and clicking on *Share* shows the window to add share details. The issue is seen only for issues which have an epic link.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Hover of 'Share' button in Jira backlog is broken
